page.title: 07Buckhaven Primary School
page.content: Buckhaven Primary School,which was built in 1915,was officially opened in June 1985! Because of the First World War, there could be no official celebrations in 1915. A modernisation programme costing nearly half a million pounds was started in 1983.The renovations were finished in 1985 and they thought it would be a good time to open the school officially. Parents,councillors,William Moodie,the Chief Constable of Fife who is a former pupil of Denbeath School, and the Rev Dean Sheppard attended the re-opening ceremony. The renovations changed some of the school completely.Individual classrooms were converted to double unit areas and an open nursery,with an observation room for parents, was created.
